thread.title: Boris: Trump ‘clear’ UK is front of queue for trade deal after our ‘BRE-ENTRY’ to world
thread.title_full: Boris: Trump ‘clear’ UK is front of queue for trade deal after our ‘BRE-ENTRY’ to world

title: Boris: Trump ‘clear’ UK is front of queue for trade deal after our ‘BRE-ENTRY’ to world

organizations.name: uk protests against president trump tue

text:
Boris: Trump ‘clear’ UK is front of queue for trade deal after our ‘BRE-ENTRY’ to world Boris: Trump ‘clear’ UK is front of queue for trade deal after our ‘BRE-ENTRY’ to world BORIS JOHNSON today revealed Donald Trump’s chief diplomat has made “clear” Britain will be “at the front of the queue for a trade deal once the UK has made it’s “Bre-entry” to the world. PUBLISHED: 12:46, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 | UPDATED: 12:53, Tue, Feb 21, 2017 GETTY • PA Boris Johnson met Donald Trump's chief diplomat last week 
The Foreign Secretary last week held his first face-to-face meeting with President Trump’s Secretary of State Rex Tillerson at a G20 meeting of foreign ministers in Bonn, Germany. 
Mr Johnson told MPs this morning the former ExxonMobil boss had made “absolutely clear he regards the relationship with the UK as of pivotal importance” to the US. Related articles Sturgeon told ‘NOcircumstances’ where Scotland can remain in EU 
The Cabinet minister added Mr Tillerson, amid concerns about President Trump’s attitude towards NATO, had told him the defence alliance was “of pivotal importance not just for the safety of Europe and European countries but also of course for the US itself”. 
Asked about the prospects of a US-UK free trade deal once Brexit is completed, Mr Johnson told the House of Commons: “He was also clear of course that the UK will be at front of the queue for a new trade deal.” The UK will be at front of the queue for a new trade deal Boris Johnson 
During Foreign Office questions, Vote Leave figurehead Mr Johnson later outlined his department’s “Global Britain” strategy to MPs. 
He said: “Global Britain is a programme to help to explain to the world - but also to the people of this country - what I think they don't often suspect, which is the full range of Britain's military, cultural, commercial, diplomatic influence in the world. 
“I do think it is important to do that now particularly as we make Brexit - or Bre-entry to the world as we perhaps should call it - to help people to understand a more Global Britain will be a more prosperous Britain.” The UK Protests Against President Trump Tue, February 21, 2017 President Trump signed an executive order banning immigration to the USA from seven 'muslim' countries. This led to protests across America and, now, the UK. Adam Gray SWNS.com 1 of 18 People gather at the Houses of Parliament in preparation for the Stop Trump protest. 20 February 2017. 
Mr Johnson predicted President Trump’s planned State Visit to the UK later this year would be a “great success” despite protests against the US leader’s trip. 
He also hit back at Labour shadow foreign secretary Emily Thornberry after she mocked President Trump’s recent description of his White House administration as a “finely-tuned machine”. 
Expressing concern a “vacuum is being filled by the Russians” as President Trump continues to deliberate on foreign policy decisions, Ms Thornberry said: “The finely-tuned machine hasn't stalled so much as it hasn't got going yet.” 
But Mr Johnson told the Labour frontbencher: “I think the finely-tuned machine that is the Labour Party is a fine one to offer any kind of political advice to the American administration.” Related articles
